abstract.p: Gretchen G Teichgraeber is named president and chief executive at Scientific American Inc, succeeding Joachim P Rosler, who resigned; Jack Rotherham, vice president and associate publisher at Rolling Stone magazine, is promoted to publisher, succeeding Terry Hummel, who resigned; Suzanne Grimes, publisher at Women's Sports & Fitness magazine, is named publisher at sibling, Allure, succeeding Erica Bartman, who is leaving; Steven Harrison is named publisher at Auto World Weekly magazine that is being introduced June 15; Rebecca Darwin is named president at VIG Network; Barbara Deering is named president at Primedia Enterprises; Abby Auerbach is named to new post of senior vice president at Television Bureau of Advertising, effective June 5; Jonathan Asher, managing partner at Coleman Group, is named president, succeeding Owen W Coleman, who remains chairman and chief executive; Stephen L Brooks is named to vacant posts of executive vice president and chief operating officer at Grafica Inc; Janet Galchus is named director for Siboney/Interactivo (Advertising column) (M)

block.p: * Gretchen G. Teichgraeber was named president and chief executive at Scientific American Inc., New York, a unit of Holtzbrinck, succeeding Joachim P. Rosler, who left to join a new Internet publishing venture. Ms. Teichgraeber had most recently been vice president for marketing and information services and general manager for publishing at CMP Media, Manhasset, N.Y., part of Miller Freeman. * Jack Rotherham, vice president and associate publisher at Rolling Stone magazine, New York, part of Wenner Media, was promoted to publisher, succeeding Terry Hummel, who resigned after 10 months to join an Internet company in Florida. * Suzanne Grimes, publisher at Women's Sports & Fitness magazine, New York, was named publisher at a sibling, Allure, succeeding Erica Bartman, who is leaving. Allure and Women's Sports & Fitness are part of the Conde Nast Publications unit of Advance Publications. * Steve Harrison was named publisher at Auto World Weekly magazine, Detroit, part of American Media Inc., a magazine that is being introduced June 15. He had been ad sales director for Car & Driver and Road & Track magazines, Detroit, both part of the Hachette Filipacchi Magazines unit of the Lagardere Group. * Rebecca Darwin was named president at VIG Network, New York, a new online business-to-business publishing company. She had been marketing director at Fortune magazine, New York, part of the Time Inc. unit of Time Warner Inc. * Barbara Deering was named president at Primedia Enterprises, New York, a new unit of Primedia specializing in licensing. She had been vice president for licensing at the EMAP Petersen unit of EMAP P.L.C., New York. * Abby Auerbach was named to the new post of senior vice president at the Television Bureau of Advertising, New York, effective June 5. She had been senior partner and director for local broadcast at Ogilvy & Mather, New York, part of the Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide unit of the WPP Group. * Jonathan Asher, managing partner at the Coleman Group, New York, part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, was named president, succeeding Owen W. Coleman, who remains chairman and chief executive. * Stephen L. Brooks was named to the vacant posts of executive vice president and chief operating officer at Grafica Inc., Chester, N.J. He had been a consultant, based in Atlanta, for various advertisers and marketers. * Janet Galchus was named director for Siboney/Interactivo, New York, a new online division of Siboney USA, part of True North Communications. She had been the New York market sales representative at ElSitio.com, which is based in Buenos Aires.
